comments:
Build ID:  I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
I'm getting exceptions that avoid the usage of my Oracle profiles.
In the Data Source Explorer the connections is unusable and in a category 'Unsupported'.
Please note that this exception does not occur every time. It seams that occures only if the SQL editor gets opened on startup.

More information:

Another problem (with the SQL Scrapbook editor):
When I select a connection using the tool bar that is not connected yet I need to do that in the Data Source explorer. It would be useful not only to present the connection status 'Unconnected' but also to allow to connect from that tool bar.

From Hui Cao: 

It looks like the problem does have something to do with SQL Editor. But SQL Editor is simply calling connectivity's API: ProfileManager.getProfileByName. Maybe at that startup time, the connectivity framework is not ready to handles calls. You can leave a SQL File editor open while closing eclipse, and restart to reproduce the problem.

Hi Stefan... I'm unable to reproduce this in the 1.5 maintenance stream. Can you try again with the latest 1.5.1 nightly build to see if you can reproduce this? If you can, can you provide more details on the steps you took to see the exception? Thanks! --Fitz
If this is still an issue, please provide the information requested above and re-open the defect.
